| History                 = 
===Overview===
The '''United States Navy''' ('''U.S.N.''') is the naval warfare service branch of the [[United States Armed Forces (Earth-616)|United States Armed Forces]]. It is one of the five branches of the United States Armed Forces, and one of the seven uniformed services of the [[United States of America]]. It is the largest and most technologically advanced navies on the planet [[Earth]]. 

===Origin===
The modern U.S. Navy has its roots in the [[United States Army (Earth-616)|Continental Army]] which was formed to fight in the [[American Revolutionary War]] against the [[Royal Navy (Earth-616)|Royal Navy]]. It was effectively disbanded as a separate entity shortly thereafter. 

===[[War of 1812]]===
The War of 1812, the second and last war between the USA and [[Great Britain]], had mixed results.{{r|Young Allies Vol 1 19}} 

===[[American Civil War (Event)|American Civil War]]===
The U.S. Navy played a major role in the American Civil War by blockading the [[Confederate States Army (Earth-616)|Confederates States Army]] and seizing control of its rivers. 

===[[World War II]]===
It played the central role in the World War II defeat of Imperial Japan. 

===Modern Age===
The Navy attempted to make its own version of [[Captain America]] using the "[[Acetovaxidol|AVX]]" patch. Loosely based off of the "Power Man Process" [[Luke Cage (Earth-616)|Luke Cage]] underwent, it was hoped that continued applications of the patch would be a more controllable dosage and keep the subject from going rogue. Unfortunately, the process seemed to aggravated the subject; [[Anti-Cap (Earth-616)|Anti-Cap]] mental problems.{{r|Captain America and the Falcon #4}}
